title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 June 2008 - XWiki
content:
vmassol - (18/06/2008 09:51): asyd: see code.xwiki.org, macro section look for the code macro  
asyd - (18/06/2008 09:55): yeah, thanks

daning - (18/06/2008 16:58): hi, vmassol. I want to co my code to sandbox. But it prompt to input username and password.   
vmassol - (18/06/2008 16:58): yep that's normal  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 16:59): hi daning   
daning - (18/06/2008 16:59): Is the password in xwiki.org ok?  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:01): you should enter your login id and password on xwiki.org yes  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:02): err wait  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:02): have you requested access to the sandbox before daning ?  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:02): I don't see you in the list  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:02): vmassol: nope  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:02): ok so that will explain it  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:03): so do you have an id on xwiki.org?  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:03): yes  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:03): My id is daning  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:03): ok adding you now  
xwikibot - (18/06/2008 17:03): XWiki.XWikiCommittersGroup was modified by xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol - http://sandbox.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiCommittersGroup  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:03): vmassol: Thanks:)  
xwikibot - (18/06/2008 17:03): XWiki.XWikiAllGroup was modified by xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol - http://sandbox.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiAllGroup  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:04): daning: done should work now  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:25): vmassol: I will develop a xwiki plugin, which can convert the office doc attached to the xwiki page (now just MS doc) to html code, tidy html, and optional convert html to xwiki code.   
daning - (18/06/2008 17:26): vmassol: the final html or xwiki code will be added to the xwiki page.  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:26): vmassol: wdyt  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:27): you might want to develop a component directly  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:28): vmassol: This plugin is something like a office document preview plugin.   
daning - (18/06/2008 17:28): component?  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:28): since this is the new architecture  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:28): anyway if youre not familiar don't bother too much now  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:28): you can do a plugin but we'll need to convert it later on  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:28): just make sure that your plugin accepts an InputStream containing the MS Doc  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:29): (it shouldn't get it from the document)  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:29): and that it produces an OutputStream containing the result  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:30): I'll be working on the XHTML to wiki converter soon now  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:31): if you have time you could look into it too  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:31): the idea is to add it in the xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-rendering/ modules  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:31): vmassol: OK. I think if the plugin works, converting it to a component that accept InputStream and produces OutputStream is not difficult.  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:31): and to use the wikimodel XHTML to wiki syntax parser  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:32): daning: the plugin should use IS and OS too  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:32): there's no need to tie the plugin to a location where the doc is stored  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:32): nor to where it'll be output  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:33): $someDoc.setContent($daningPlugin.convert($doc.getAttachment("...")))  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:33): $someDoc.save()  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:33): vmassol: OK. I will product such interface.  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:33): the reason for streams is that docs can be lengthy  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:34): and they could possibly not fit in memory or in a Java String object  
daning - (18/06/2008 17:34): vmassol: right  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:34): (of course we'll have problems with $doc.setContent() since that takes a string but that's a problem of another part of xwiki)  
vmassol - (18/06/2008 17:34): (let's make our part nice and clean :))
